tool.name: SAGA.shapes_tools.22
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayINPUT False isArrayFIELD_ID False isArrayFIELD_X False isArrayFIELD_Y False isArrayFIELD_Z False output_data_OUTPUT $output_data_OUTPUT name SAGA.shapes_tools.22 INPUT $INPUT FIELD_ID $FIELD_ID FIELD_X $FIELD_X FIELD_Y $FIELD_Y FIELD_Z $FIELD_Z SHAPE_TYPE $SHAPE_TYPE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_OUTPUT $OutputSection_OUTPUT.outputType_OUTPUT transmissionMode_OUTPUT $OutputSection_OUTPUT.transmissionMode_OUTPUT

param.name: INPUT
param.label: Input
param.help: Table with coordinates. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: FIELD_ID
param.label: ID
param.help: Field with the identifier. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: FIELD_X
param.label: X
param.help: Field with the x coordinate. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: FIELD_Y
param.label: Y
param.help: Field with the y coordinate. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: FIELD_Z
param.label: Z
param.help: Field with the z coordinate. The following data types are allowed in the txt file: csv

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_OUTPUT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_OUTPUT
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: The tool allows one to generate point, line or polygon shapes from a table with the following attribute fields:<br/><br/>- identifier<br/>- x coordinate<br/>- y coordinate<br/>- optional: z coordinate (this will create a 3D shapefile)<br/><br/>The table must be sorted in vertex order.<br/><br/>The identifier has different meanings:<br/><br/>* Point Shapes: The identifier is arbitrary<br/><br/>* Line Shapes: The identifier is unique for each line<br/><br/>* Polygon Shapes: The identifier is unique for each polygon; the first polygon vertex may but must not be duplicated in order to close the polygon<br/><br/>
